channel.title: Comments on: Beware the defaults! (in windowing functions) – The Movie!
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Koen Verbeeck
item.dc:creator: Koen Verbeeck
item.description: @Steve: it is described in pages 120 and following. Page 124 lists the conditions for the in-memory work table at the bottom. Don't worry, I missed it too on my first read :D
item.content:encoded: @Steve: it is described in pages 120 and following. Page 124 lists the conditions for the in-memory work table at the bottom. Don’t worry, I missed it too on my first read ðŸ˜€

item.title: By: Steve Bolton
item.dc:creator: Steve Bolton
item.description: Thanks for the article - I use windowing functions all the time and pitch Itzik Ben-Gan's book every chance I get. I missed the part about the internal difference between ROWS and RANGE though - I'll have to keep that in mind. Thanks for the heads-up.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the article – I use windowing functions all the time and pitch Itzik Ben-Gan’s book every chance I get. I missed the part about the internal difference between ROWS and RANGE though – I’ll have to keep that in mind. Thanks for the heads-up.

item.title: By: Koen Verbeeck
item.dc:creator: Koen Verbeeck
item.description: Hi Joe, thanks for the nice words. I'm not responsible for the creation of the video however, so I'm afraid there won't be a sequel (pun intended) on ROW vs RANGE.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Joe, thanks for the nice words.
I’m not responsible for the creation of the video however, so I’m afraid there won’t be a sequel (pun intended) on ROW vs RANGE.

item.title: By: Joe Celko
item.dc:creator: Joe Celko
item.description: Nice job! I hope that the "the horrible default" is fixed and people know not to use it. However, can you do a video on ROW versus RANGE? I sill have to think about it myself ..
item.content:encoded: Nice job! I hope that the “the horrible default” is fixed and people know not to use it. However, can you do a video on ROW versus RANGE? I sill have to think about it myself ..
